parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It encourages voters to be informed and not leave their vote to chance, but doesn't endorse any particular candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience of Romanian voters.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to influence the vote for a specific candidate or party. The aim is to encourage informed voting, a goal that is not inherently partisan.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post promotes a website (eucucinevotez.eu) that likely provides information to help voters make informed choices. This aligns with journalistic principles of informing the public.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it promotes a resource for informed voting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1500150454026774</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a website designed to help voters make informed choices. It does not endorse any particular candidate or party, and its objective is to encourage participation in the electoral process, not to sway votes towards a specific outcome.  While the post falls under the "POLITICAL" category, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.  The post does not directly refer to a candidate (a), its objective is not to influence votes for a specific candidate (c), and it does not exceed the limits of journalistic information (d). The timing of the post, after the official campaign period, is not relevant as it does not promote any specific candidate or party.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
